author: Terrence Thomas
title: Double Trouble
text:

(Darren Abate/For the ... more Photo: Darren Abate, FRE / Darren Abate/Express-News Image 9 of 10 MacArthur's Jade De La Rosa, rear, celebrates a point with teammate Madison Trawick during a District 26-6A high school volleyball match against Madison, Tuesday, Oct. 6, 2015, at Littleton Gymnasium in San Antonio. (Darren Abate/For the Express-News) MacArthur's Jade De La Rosa, rear, celebrates a point with teammate Madison Trawick during a District 26-6A high school volleyball match against Madison, Tuesday, Oct. 6, 2015, at Littleton Gymnasium in San ... more Photo: Darren Abate, FRE / Darren Abate/Express-News Image 10 of 10 Double Trouble 1 / 10 Back to Gallery Five years ago, MacArthur’s Mallory Potts and Madison Trawick were discussing their paths in volleyball, tracing their start in the sport to where they stood at that moment.
The more they talked, the more similarities they found in their treks. The players learned they were always the youngest on their club teams because they played up in age level. They also discovered they had competed against one another while playing YMCA ball when they were about 8 years old.
The bond has been instrumental in why Potts and Trawick are the Greater San Antonio area’s most productive 1-2 attacking combination. Both junior outside hitters, the duo this season has combined for 1,105 kills - Potts has an area-leading 575 kills, while Trawick has 530, which ranks No. 2.
For more, check out ExpressNews.com .
